intro: Parietaria feliciana, commonly known as the velvetleaf or creeping wood sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy coating and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. It produces small, smooth fruits that contain three seeds. Parietaria feliciana is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and adaptability.
